Dialogue.NPCText:
A wary woman in an icy blue kimono inspects you with a piercing stare. Her short spear gleams, adorned with ofuda talismans. Whispered prayers fall from her lips between each sentence.

“Stay alert, traveler. This town is thick with spirits and worse. I am Ayame—yokai hunter, spear-wielder, and last line between Hinokami and corruption.”

“Do you seek protection, wish to help cleanse these lands, or have you come to question my sanity as so many do?”

Option.text: What do you mean—spirits and corruption?
I want to help you hunt ghosts or yokai.
Are you sure the council is really possessed?
Maybe you should rest, Ayame.
Tell me more about yourself, Ayame.
Just passing by.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame lowers her spear, voice taut.
“Minax’s shadow twists more than just men—it festers in the unseen. Many you meet here carry yokai in their eyes, or worse. Council, merchants, even the shrine maidens... I alone see the signs.”

“Do you trust your senses, or would you rather test your courage and see for yourself?”

Option.text: Tell me how to see the possessed.
Maybe it’s safer to leave this alone.
Give me a task—let me help cleanse Hinokami.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame draws a slip of parchment covered in swirling kanji.
“These are ofuda—spirit wards. Press it to any Hinokami citizen and the truth will surface: a shimmer of malice, a flicker in the eyes, or a violent outburst if the yokai is strong.”

“Are you brave enough to test someone? I will entrust you with a ward.”

Option.text: I’ll do it. Give me an ofuda ward.
What if the person really is possessed?
I’m not ready for this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame slips a ward into your hand. It tingles with faint power.
“Choose wisely. If you use it on the wrong person, you may offend them. But the truly possessed will reveal themselves—and perhaps attack.

Return to me if you find proof, and I’ll reward you with coin and a greater blessing.”

Option.text: Thank you. I’ll begin at once.
What should I do if a yokai attacks me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame’s expression softens for a moment.
“Good. Spirits gather wherever Minax’s shadow falls. Just last night, villagers heard moans by the old well and saw lantern-lights floating in the forest.”

“I can offer two tasks. Will you confront a haunted villager, or investigate the well for restless ghosts?”

Option.text: Give me the ward—I’ll confront a villager.
I’ll investigate the haunted well.
Can I do both?
I need more time to prepare.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Take this talisman. Toss it into the well at midnight, and any angry spirits will manifest. Defeat them, and bring me proof—a fragment of spectral cloth.”
“Do not go alone if you value your life.”

Option.text: I accept. I’ll return with proof.
Is there a reward for this task?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame nods. “Such courage is rare. Take both items, but beware—too much meddling with spirits marks you in their eyes.”
“Return with proof from both tasks, and I’ll grant you a special blessing.”

Option.text: Thank you, Ayame. I’ll see this done.
I’ll start with the well first.
Actually, I’m not ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame presses the talisman for the haunted well into your hand.
“Spirits see bravery as both an offering and a challenge. Walk carefully, friend.”

“If a yokai attacks, defend yourself! Use iron, prayer, or run for the shrine. Never show fear—they feed on it.”
“Should you survive, bring me a token of their defeat: a talon, a torn mask, or a wisp of ghostly hair.”

Option.text: Thank you. I’ll remember that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame’s eyes flash with suspicion.
“They walk and speak as men, but sometimes their shadows twist, and their words ring hollow. If you trust them, you risk Hinokami’s soul.”

“Bring me proof—anything strange from a council member—and I’ll trust you more than anyone else here.”

Option.text: I’ll investigate the council.
Maybe you are right to be cautious.
You sound obsessed, Ayame.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame snorts. “Madness and clarity are sisters—one steps from the other with every new moon. I hope you never learn which side you walk.”
“Still, only a fool ignores what lurks in the mists. If you change your mind, my offer stands.”

Option.text: I will keep my eyes open.
Actually, tell me about your work.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Bring me spectral cloth, or any proof of a banished yokai, and I’ll reward you: coin, and a blessing of protection for a day.”
“Few in Hinokami appreciate my work, but you—perhaps you see the true battle.”

Option.text: I won’t let you down.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame exhales sharply, her grip on the spear relaxing just slightly.
“No one ever asks that. Not without suspicion. But maybe… you’re different.”

“I was not always a hunter. I was once a shrine maiden of the Amateru Path. I lived among blossoms and prayers, not blades and banshees.”

Option.text: What changed?
So you were a spiritual healer?
I didn't expect that from a warrior.
You seem more spirit than flesh now...

Dialogue.NPCText:
“My village fell. Not to armies or fire—but to whispers.”
“The elder smiled sweetly one day and drank ink the next. Children giggled in languages they never learned. And the night sky bent the wrong way.”

“Only I could see the yokai feeding. I fled, spear in hand, voice hoarse from prayers that no longer worked.”
“Since then... I’ve hunted the unseen.”

Option.text: You survived where others couldn’t.
That’s a heavy burden.
Is that when you came to Hinokami?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes. I once painted sutras and chanted beneath moonlight.”
“The spirits whispered secrets then too—but gentler ones. I thought I understood the balance. I was wrong.”

“Now I write my prayers in blood. And sometimes the spirits answer.”

Option.text: Have the spirits ever helped you?
And you still believe?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame meets your eyes, surprised.
“Few call it courage. Most just say madness.”
“Here—take this. A minor ward. May it shield you when your mind starts to crack like mine.”

Option.text: Thank you. I’ll carry your strength with me.
You are more stable than you think.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Some nights, I dream of their faces. They stare... then split open.”
“Grief is a river with no mouth. I’ve just learned to breathe underwater.”
“But I thank you for seeing the weight. Most do not.”

Option.text: Your strength humbles me.
I will remember your story.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I wandered for years. Monasteries turned me away. Towns feared me. Pirates tried to hire me.”
“Only Hinokami’s monks offered shelter—though they keep their distance. They pray. I pierce.”
“Maybe balance still exists.”

Option.text: You were meant to be here.
You keep Hinokami safe in your own way.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A fox once warned me of a poisoned blade.”
“A whisper led me to a buried charm that saved a child from drowning.”
“They are not all evil... but they are all dangerous.”
“Some ask for favors. Others only hunger. I answer the ones who bleed.”

Option.text: Would you teach me to listen to spirits?
You walk between worlds, Ayame.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame pauses.
“I do. Because without belief, all I’ve done means nothing.”
“I believe not in gods, but in the hope that one blade, one prayer, one act... still matters.”
“Even if no one sees it but the dead.”

Option.text: You give meaning to your fight.
I’ll carry that belief too.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“That’s the kindest curse I’ve heard.”
“Some say I’m half-yokai now. Others whisper I never bled when cut. I know only this: my path chose me. I walk it until it ends.”

“But perhaps you were meant to walk beside it for a time.”

Option.text: Our paths cross for a reason.
I’ll walk with you—for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame presses a charm into your hand.
“This charm once guided me to safety. Meditate with it under moonlight, and your hearing may shift. Spirits whisper softly at first. Listen carefully.”

*(You gain a temporary boost to your Spirit Speak skill.)*

Option.text: Thank you. I will use it wisely.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ayame returns to sharpening her spear, but her eyes linger on you a moment longer.
“Be careful where your curiosity takes you. The past has long shadows.”

*(You feel something old and sorrowful stir behind her gaze.)*

Option.text: I’ll tread carefully, hunter.
I’ll be back soon.
